Law student falls from 7th floor during party at friend's Noida apartment, dies - Hindustan Times
summary:
Law Student Falls from 7th Floor During Party at Friend's Noida Apartment, Dies

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic incident occurred when a law student, identified as Tapas, fell to his death from the seventh floor of a Noida apartment complex during a party at a friend's residence.

  • The incident took place at Supreme Towers in Sector 99, Noida.
  • Police received reports about the fall shortly after the party began.
  • Tapas was an LLB student at a private university in Noida.
  • Authorities are investigating whether the death was accidental or involved foul play.
  • The student's family has been informed, and a post-mortem has been conducted.

Notable Quotes

“Police are conducting a thorough investigation, examining all possible angles in the case.”

Past incidents highlight recurring issues of students falling from high-rise buildings in Noida.
newTitle: Law Student Dies After Falling from 7th Floor During Party in Noida

title: Jasprit Bumrah set to miss Champions Trophy group stage matches because of back swelling - The Indian Express
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah set to miss Champions Trophy group stage matches due to back swelling

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

In a setback for India, strike bowler Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss the group stage of next month’s Champions Trophy due to health reasons.

  • Bumrah has swelling on his back and has been advised to report to the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru for recovery monitoring.
  • The Champions Trophy starts on February 19, with matches scheduled in Karachi, Rawalpindi, Lahore, and Dubai.
  • The BCCI has requested an extension for announcing the squad as they monitor Bumrah’s fitness.
  • Selectors are debating whether to include Bumrah in the squad or reserve list; provisional squads can be submitted with changes allowed until February 12.
  • Bumrah is expected to return to full fitness by the first week of March.
  • He previously missed nearly 11 months of cricket due to surgery on his back.
“He (Bumrah) will be going to NCA for his rehabilitation. The initial report says he doesn’t have a fracture but has swelling on his back.”

If Bumrah is not fit by March 2, he may miss the group's last match against New Zealand. India's group games include matches against Bangladesh on February 20 and Pakistan on February 23.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah set to miss Champions Trophy group stage matches due to back swelling

title: 7 Unseen outer space images by NASA - India.com
summary:
7 Unseen Outer Space Images by NASA

Publication Date: January 12, 2025   Source: India.com

This article showcases a collection of breathtaking images taken by NASA's powerful space telescopes, revealing the wonders of the universe.

  • Highlights images of binary black holes at the core of Markarian 231.
  • Analysis of young star HH-47 and its gravitational interactions.
  • Discoveries of the protostar OH 339.88-1.26 and its unique dust lanes.
  • Insights into turbulent gas flows in galaxy NGC 5548.
  • Exploration of star-forming clouds such as AFGL 5180.
  • Depictions of the possible formation of supermassive black holes.
  • Research on a supermassive black hole ejecting double bubbles of hot gas.
“Scientists have witnessed a supermassive black hole ejecting two massive bubbles of hot gas. One bubble is actively expanding outward, while the other, older bubble, is gradually fading.”

The featured images not only deliver stunning views of space but also deepen our understanding of astronomical phenomena.
newTitle: 7 Unseen Outer Space Images by NASA

California fire live updates: Governor Newsom slams Elon Musk for ‘encouraging looting’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
California Wildfires: Governor Newsom Criticizes Elon Musk Over Looting Claims

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

California is grappling with raging wildfires in Los Angeles, resulting in significant destruction and loss of life. Governor Gavin Newsom has condemned remarks by Elon Musk suggesting looting has been decriminalized.

  • At least 11 people have died due to the wildfires, and approximately 12,000 structures have been destroyed.
  • Authorities estimate damage costs could reach as high as $150 billion.
  • Evacuations are in effect for over 150,000 residents as air quality severely deteriorates.
  • Newsom has doubled the deployment of National Guardsmen to assist with wildfire responses.
  • The Los Angeles area has struggled with insufficient water supply for firefighting efforts.
  • Noteworthy personalities, including Disney CEO Bob Iger, have pledged substantial aid for recovery efforts.
“Stop encouraging looting by lying and telling people it’s decriminalized. It’s not. It’s illegal as it always has been.” - Governor Gavin Newsom

The situation remains critical as wildfires continue to blaze and officials warn of potential future flare-ups.
newTitle: California Wildfires: Governor Newsom Criticizes Elon Musk Over Looting Claims

title: With two new cases in a day, HMPV count rises to five in Gujarat - The Indian Express
summary:
With two new cases in a day, HMPV count rises to five in Gujarat

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

A nine-month-old child and a 59-year-old man have tested positive for human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Gujarat, bringing the total number of cases in the state to five. All cases have been reported in less than a week.

  • All five cases were confirmed within a week starting from January 6.
  • The first case was a two-month-old boy from Rajasthan.
  • Symptoms of HMPV include fever, nasal congestion, runny nose, and cough.
  • The virus spreads through respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces.
The pathogen spreads through respiratory droplets from coughing or sneezing...

As cases of HMPV rise in Gujarat, health officials are monitoring the situation closely and promoting awareness about the virus.
newTitle: Gujarat Sees Rise in HMPV Cases with Two New Infections

title: Deals: OnePlus 13 launches while 13R goes on pre-order, Red Magic 10 Pro also available - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
What is Rabbit Fever: Know the symptoms and prevention tips for this rare condition - The Times of India
summary:
What is Rabbit Fever: Know the symptoms and prevention tips for this rare condition

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Rabbit fever, also known as tularaemia, is a rare bacterial infection caused by Francisella tularensis. Reports indicate a significant increase in cases in the United States, with a 56% rise from 2011 to 2022 according to the CDC.

Key Points

  • The primary cause is the bacterium Francisella tularensis, transmitted through insect bites, direct contact with infected animals, contaminated water, or inhalation of infected aerosols.
  • High-risk groups include children aged 5–9, older adults, and residents of endemic regions like Arkansas, Kansas, Missouri, and Oklahoma.
  • Symptoms vary by type but may include skin ulcers, swollen lymph nodes, sore throat, and severe respiratory issues.
  • While treatable with antibiotics if caught early, untreated severe forms can have a mortality rate as high as 24%.
  • Preventive measures include using insect repellents, wearing protective clothing, and avoiding contaminated water.
“Awareness of symptoms and early medical attention can significantly reduce risks.”

In conclusion, understanding and preventing rabbit fever is crucial, especially for individuals at higher risk. Awareness and education play a key role in reducing the incidence of this rare disease.
newTitle: Understanding Rabbit Fever: Symptoms and Prevention Tips

title: Santner-led New Zealand announce 15-member ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025 squad - ICC Cricket
summary:
New Zealand Announces 15-Member Squad for ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025

New Zealand has revealed its 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Men's Champions Trophy 2025, led by captain Mitchell Santner.

  • Ferguson is set to make his fifth appearance in an ICC event.

  • The squad includes notable players such as Kane Williamson and Devon Conway.

New Zealand's Group Stage Fixtures:

Ram Mandir Inaugurated On January 22 But 1st Anniversary Being Celebrated Today | Here's Why - News18
summary:
Ram Mandir Inaugurated On January 22 But 1st Anniversary Being Celebrated Today | Here's Why

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: News18

Today marks the beginning of the Pratishtha Dwadashi celebrations in Ayodhya, a significant spiritual event to honour one year since the installation of Shri Ram Lalla at the grand Ram Mandir.

  • The Pran Pratishtha Mahotsav of Shri Ram Lalla occurred on January 22, 2024.
  • January 11 is chosen for annual celebrations based on the Hindu lunar calendar.
  • Celebrations include various religious and cultural programmes attracting devotees from all over the country.
  • The temple is designed in the traditional Nagara architectural style, featuring significant dimensions and structures.
  • January 11 matches with deep spiritual traditions associated with Lord Vishnu and historical prayers for Lord Ram.
“This date holds deep spiritual meaning and is aligned with traditional Hindu practices.”

The anniversary celebrates not just an architectural milestone but also a deep-seated cultural and spiritual identity for the community.
newTitle: Ram Mandir Inauguration Anniversary Celebrated with Spiritual Significance

The article discusses the potential travel plans of the Indonesian president, who may choose to separate his visit to India's Republic Day celebrations from a trip to Pakistan.

  • The Indonesian president's visit to India is traditionally associated with Republic Day.
  • There is speculation regarding whether this visit will coincide with a trip to Pakistan.
  • The decision may reflect Indonesia's diplomatic stance and relations with both countries.
“The Indonesian government has to carefully evaluate its diplomatic relations.”

This situation underscores the complex geopolitical dynamics in the region.

title: Japan reports record-high flu cases since 1999 - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Japan reports record-high flu cases since 1999

Date: January 11, 2023 Source: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare

Japan is experiencing a significant flu outbreak, with the highest reported number of influenza cases since record-keeping began in 1999. The surge in cases has led to concerns as all prefectures report increases in patient numbers.

  • In the last week of December, Japan reported 317,812 flu patients across around 5,000 institutions.
  • The average number of patients per facility was 64.39, surpassing the warning level of 30.
  • This marked the tenth consecutive week of increases in flu cases.
  • Every one of the 47 prefectures in Japan recorded rising numbers, with 43 exceeding the warning level.
  • Oita Prefecture reported the highest average at 104.84 cases per clinic.
  • Major cities like Osaka and Tokyo saw averages of 67.53 and 56.52 cases per facility, respectively.
“The fact that people expanded their range of movement as they entered the holidays could be a contributing factor,” a ministry official stated.

Overall, the flu outbreak is prompting significant health monitoring across Japan, as the reported cases continue to rise.
newTitle: Record High Flu Cases Reported in Japan Since 1999

title: Greenland's leader agrees to negotiations with US president Donald Trump - Hindustan Times
summary:
Greenland's Leader Willing to Discuss Future with President Trump

Date: Jan 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

During a press conference in Denmark, Greenland's leader Múte Egede said he is open to negotiating with US president-elect Donald Trump about Greenland's future, emphasizing the desire for independence.

  • Múte Egede expressed readiness for dialogue with US President Donald Trump.
  • Egede emphasized Greenlandic independence and the importance of being self-governing.
  • Trump had previously shown interest in acquiring control over Greenland, citing economic security.
  • Danish PM Mette Frederiksen stated that Greenland belongs to its people and is not for sale.
“We have a desire for independence, a desire to be the master of our own house … This is something everyone should respect. Greenland is for the Greenlandic people.” - Múte Egede

This event highlights ongoing discussions about Greenland's future and its relationship with the United States and Denmark.
newTitle: Greenland's Leader Willing to Discuss Future with President Trump

Weekend Reads | Which Is Healthier: Dark or Milk Chocolate? - southseattleemerald.org
summary:
Which Is Healthier: Dark or Milk Chocolate?

Published on: Jan 11, 2025, 6:15 pm

This article explores the health effects of dark and milk chocolate based on a comprehensive study conducted by researchers at Harvard's T.H. Chan School of Public Health.

  • The study assessed data from 192,000 participants with no prior history of Type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, or cancer.
  • It found that overall chocolate consumption had minimal impact on diabetes risk.
  • In contrast, dark chocolate consumption was associated with a significantly lower risk of developing Type 2 diabetes compared to milk chocolate.
  • Multiple confounding factors were controlled for in the analysis, strengthening the association between dark chocolate and health benefits.
It really did appear to be the chocolate that was lowering the risk for developing diabetes — and the more dark chocolate consumed, the lower the risk (up to a point; too much of anything is unhealthy).

In conclusion, opting for dark chocolate over milk chocolate may provide health benefits, suggesting a more nuanced approach to chocolate consumption.
newTitle: Which Is Healthier: Dark or Milk Chocolate?
